content.question: A particle moves along the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that at time <math alttext="t is greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math> its position is given by <math alttext="y of t, equals t cubed, minus 4 times t squared, plus 4, t, plus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>. Which of the following statements describes the motion of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: The particle is moving down the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis with decreasing velocity.
The particle is moving down the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis with increasing velocity.
The particle is moving up the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis with decreasing velocity.
The particle is moving up the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis with increasing velocity.

content.answer: The particle is moving down the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis with decreasing velocity.

topic.text: 2.4: Connecting Differentiability and Continuity - Determining When Derivatives Do and Do Not Exist

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
